metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6564 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the mm_answer_pam_free_ctx function in monitor.c in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.0 on non-OpenBSD platforms might allow local users to gain privileges by leveraging control of the sshd uid to send an unexpectedly early MONITOR_REQ_PAM_FREE_CTX request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
openssh-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
openssh-sftp-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
ssh - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
ssh-krb5 - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.2').
